text: Cask Half Pint at White Horse Old Ale Festival 2012, Parsons Green, London in Nov 2015 - Jet Black in colour. Beige head. Aroma of whisky, roast malts, chocolate and dark fruits. Very Malty; roasty malts, roast coffee, dark chocolate, toffee, wood, vanilla and whisky notes, smoke. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins. Viscous, spicy, silky and smooth. Hoppy; balancing hop bitterness. Warming alcohol. Sweet-bitter roasty coffee and chocolate malty and fruity throughout. Complex. Lots of character. Excellent Old Ale! (2015-11-19)

APPEARANCE- Perfectly black with no head and no lacing. Very light brown color at the very edge of the thumbnail.
NOSE- STELLAR! Smells sweet and slightly boozy at the same time. Exactly as expected for a barrel aged and cellared beauty beer.
FLAVOR- first thing that hits me is its surprisingly thin. The nose is deceptive compared to the flavor. The flavor is distinctively stout, but significantly lighter in nature than youd expect for the way it smells and looks. Really good beer, however I was anticipating a much heavier beer.

Cask at Andrew Ushers , Edinburgh, Sunday 20th March 2016 in the company of Dad, Barry, Craig, Stella, Jan and Charlotte. (courtesy of Craig, cheers mate!)  Pours black (pitch black) lots of whisky on the nose, a touch boozy, I like it, great temperature, warming, nice silky smooth mouthfeel, lovely beer.  A7 A4 T9 P4 Ov16 4.1
Cask in Tilleys Bar, Newcastle. Black with a cream head. Whiskey aroma. Smokey with coffee and chocolate. Smooth and very good.

Cask handpull at The White Horse Old Ale Festival, 2015. 10.5%. Rich oily black, small bubbly tan head. Aroma is sweet molasses, whisky, woody vanilla. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is smooth buttery whisky, vanilla, wood, light chocolate. Long musty finish with some spice. Very drinkable for strength.

Aroma: bourbon, peat, molasses, caramel, toasted malts, dark grains. Appearance: black, no head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: very subtle bourbon, or should I say Whiskey, intensifying, alcohol, peat, oily texture, alcohol in the long finish. Overall: a ridiculous bargain at the Sloaney Pony for 90p on a Monday evening, fantastic palate, probably one of the best palates Ive ever tasted. Pint at the White Horse, Parsons Green.
Cask at ushers. Pours black, nose is chocolate, oak, coconut, whisky, taste is sweet, rich, smoked sausage, toffee, vanilla, boozy.

Cask at Ushers, as 10.5%. Pours quite flat, black. Whisky is dominant in nose but still in quite soft way, also dark chocolate, roast, dark fruits. Taste is very soft and smooth, whisky, peat, slight vanilla and burnt caramel, dark chocolate. Excellent soft and strong beer but strong whisky taste so you better like whisky as well.

Cask at 33rd Old Ale fest at White Horse, Parsons Green, London. A black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Roasty, whiskey, caramel, dark fruit aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, whiskey, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate. Very rich and slight smoke.

Handpump at the WHOAF 2015 - London. Pours oily, mostly clear, deep brown with a small, bubbly tan head. Rich semi-dark malts in the nose, brown sugar, heavy peat, dried berries. Hearty sweet flavor with rich burnt malts, oily peat, charred wood, earth, slight vanilla. Full bodied, oily and chewy, with soft carbonation. Warm to hot on the finish, with lingering peat, smokey fire, burnt toast, scorched earth. Great depth. If you like peat, and I do, then you will love this.

Cask at the White Horse Old Ale Festival, 19/11/15.
Black with a moderate tan head of bubbles. 
Nose is rich chocolate, spice, tannins, dark fruit shreds, smoke, good whisky vibes, earthy.
Taste comprises light peated malt, spice, dark malts, light charr, wooded notes, chocolate, raisens, toffee fudge. 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a good boost.
Solid well balanced whisky olde.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask, hand-pull at WHOAF 2015. It pours jet black with a tiny, bubbly tan head. The nose is so rich, sweet, oily, stewed dark fruits, fruit cake, eccles cake, vanilla, cherry bakewell, sweet roast, juicy whisky, heather honey and light smoked peat. The taste is slick, oily, unctuous, warming alcohol, eccles cake, earthy roast, charred wood, Neapolitan ice-cream, liquorice, rich roast, mocha, stewed strawberries, umami, rocky road, burnt toast and a touch of peppery spice with a dry, warming finish. Full body and fine carbonation. Slick mouth-feel. Staggeringly brilliant, great depth and yet somehow highly drinkability. Perfect for a whisky and beer lover. Exceptional.

On cask at Winstons. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - wood, wood spice and whisky against a dark chocolate backdrop. 
Taste - deep dark chocolate, boozy edge. A hint of liquorice or molasses. 
Palate - full bodied with a rich creamy texture and a long rich finish. 
Overall - the beer just about holds the huge whisky influence.
Cask at winstons. Pours jet black with a thin tan head. Strong whisky and chocolate aromas. Taste is liquorice, tar, whisky, liqueur chocolates. Rich, oily texture. Long boozy, chewy finish.
Dark with almost no head. Aroma roasted, tar, mocha,licorice. Taste as aroma. Alcohol well hidden. Full bode, text smottth and oily. No carb.
Edinburgh at the Guilford Arms: 1/2 pint was plenty of this big and intense brew. Lovely whisky and burnt malt flavor.

Cask @ The Rake, Borough SE1. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty smokey whisky aroma. Roasted malty licorice and smokey whisky flavor with hints of dark fruit. Has a roasted malty smokey whisky finish.

2010-12-03. Viscous black body, near headless. 3+ Strong flavour of alcohol and whiskey is a bit off-putting. Nice malty base but the alcohol and whiskey really dominates the flavour profile. Aroma is similar, alcohol, whiskey, light barrel notes. 6+ Smooth medium bodied is accompanied by a mild alcohol burn throughout. Solid, its a bit disappointing. Shows potential but ends up being too rough for me to handle. Cask at Coles, Buffalo"...and Bob is very uncomfortable with children. Especially around his crotch." - Overheard.

Cask (handpump) @ The Rake, 14 Winchester Walk, London, Greater London England SE1 9AG.Clear dark brown color with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, beige head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, burnt, chocolate malt, smoke, tar. Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is flat. [20100802]

[3501-20101203] Cask. Roasted wooden chocolate aroma. Black body with quick off-white bubbles. Boozy bandaid whiskey flavour has wood roast and a lingering sweet aftertaste. Full body is quite boozy. Wow, interesting, and surprisingly drinkable.
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)
cask @ Coles, Buffalo, NY. Dark brown/black pour. Peaty, smoke, scotch, wood notes along with rich roasted maltiness. Not so much boozy at 10%. Fuller mouthfeel thats packed with flavor. A real treat

Dark cloudy brown. Wow. Mild sweet aroma with scotch-like sweetness ans a whiff smoke. Taste is bigger than expected with a nutty-toffee sweetness, and some gorgeously balanced peaty-smoky scotch barrel flavor. Perhaps the best OD overall?
This is a very nice ale--I really question whether its worth the money, though. The whiskey barely comes through and its otherwise a very solid, traditional old ale.

Cask Stillage from the Cellar at the Rake, Southwark 02/08/2010 (Thanks Chris O)
Big whisky aroma. Black very strong in alcohol and smooth on the palate with a hint of dryness and bitterness in a coffee roast finish.

Pitch black colour, small brown head. Aroma is mild smooth whisky along with caramel malts, some wooden notes as well as vanilla and some mild toasted notes. Flavour is whisky, wooden notes, vanilla, mild fruityness, roast and some slight alcohol as well. Extremely pleasantly balanced and drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2010 Ola Dubh 30 year cask, tap, half, at the Rake. Distinct caramel; oak, leather, woody mouth feel and vanilla. Similar oak reminscence of St Julien. MM. Much better on cask. Better than the 12 year. A complex winter brew to keep you in steamin shape all night long.

A Mes rate. Cask at the Rake.Black brown, totally opaque, no head what-so-ever. It still looks pretty inviting though. Amazing aroma. A truck load of burnt caramel and chocolate, hints of vanilla and leather and a good 30 year vintage undertone. The flavour is full on creamy chocolate and whisky. The caramel and vanilla are there along with some dark fruit. Slight peaty hit in the finish and a good deal of the Highland Park showing through. Hints of seaweed and over ripe plum in the aftertaste. Actually, the aftertaste is what makes it. Its sublime. Amazing length and giving up more of everything it has to offer. Certainly better than the bottled version. Bloody excellent stuff. Really smooth and dare I say it, downable. Im really struggling to get this rate out quick enough. Sod it. *GULP*

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2015 CASK @ guilford solid black ...bubbly tan head ...light sweet toffee ... soft vanilla toffee roast ... def whisky linger ... rich soft deep  ... little meaty Bat.  Deep black... Light. Whisky... Solid riast dark malts.. Sift smooth silky body.. Mellow roast... Nice 4.1

Cask at ushers... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft sweet chocolate roast.. Dark malts big soft whisky.. Light iodine nose.. Quite smoke.. Dark sweet malts.. Big iodine.. Dark chocolate roast
